Tvvn1AsBYVvqmAvat9dAMA.text: Went there on Mothers Day, the chicken fajitas were great! The portion size was big enough to split between two but we did not know that so we we took the leftovers home; a nice bonus! The chicken tamale my daughter ordered was huge too and very good. My other daughter ordered the taco plate with rice and beans, it looked fabulous. I did not taste it but she said it was great. We ordered the fried ice cream for desert and it was great too! The waitress was very pleasant and she made sure our drinks were always full, asked if we wanted additional salsa without us having to ask for it.  We will go back!!!!

q1pZMXb5W1yHYmb8oBPYmQ.text: Yum. Try the steak fajitas.  They charge for any extras. Our fajitas came out with hardly any peppers and onions at all. I asked if we could have some more, and when the check came I was charged $4 for a side of grilled onions (didn't even have any peppers) So I felt a little ripped off, but I still love the steak fajitas and I also love the rice and beans. I will be back and nextime not order any extras to be safe.

q3hZ0WLMMUwecPG1jAT81A.text: This is our favorite Mexican Restaurant to go to hands down! You can usually find us here every 2 weeks! The staff is always so kind and cheerful! The food is delicious! If I ever get married in the future I would love for this restaurant to cater for me!

hG7xiBxOvif6kFsvaIr7oA.text: This is the best Mexican food I've ever had. To be fair, I just moved here from the Midwest, but I've still eaten a LOT of Mexican in my life. La Pinata is unmatched in terms of price, portion, flavor, and overall quality. A $12 appetizer nachos supreme filled up both my girlfriend and I. If it wasn't so unbelievably flavorful we even would've had leftovers. The fried ice cream defied all expectations by coming with a chocolate tortilla. The flavor of the ice cream and toppings would've been fantastic by themselves. We will be returning on a weekly basis. Highly recommend.

_FYP_jECQZ_c2bkRott6eg.text: We arrive for the first time, greeted immediately with a smile and seated promptly. Our server was fantastic, he was funny and fast. Gave great suggestions on the menu and we both were very pleased with the food, flavors, speed and accuracy of our orders. We will definitely be going back for more great food!

g7TteM85LRKffRG8BLUDZg.text: Delicious food, nice ambiance and great service! My family and I have been here twice since their new relocation. What an improvement from the old building they used to be in. On our most recent visit I ordered the beef mini chimis. It would be great if there was an option to have them available 1/2 chicken and the other 1/2 beef. Nonetheless they were delicious and the cream cheese dip is out of this world! Their refried beans and rice are authentic and delicious. The prices are moderate and affordable. I look forward to my next visit to try a margarita.

sRqF_jRfs9pjTw7Kueg0UA.text: Wow. This placed just opened and I will definitely be back.  The waiters were so friendly and eager to please.  The decor was beautifully done and fresh feeling with a traditional Mexican vibe.   Now... Let's talk food. Absolutely classic and authentic Mexican food. It was fresh and high quality. And...delicious. The tamales were the best I've ever tasted. Everyone at our table enjoyed their food. My husband had the chile relleno and loved it. They have a great bar too!! The margarita was the perfect addition to my dinner.   Keep it up, La Pinata!! Can't wait for my next visit!

aZhIHLoaEGP14Xde3Fd1MA.text: Legit street tacos. Decent margarita. Good guac. Bland salsa. Super excitable server which beats the alternative.

HX1DVVDt0RJa6ei_9PlPSA.text: First impression was great thanks to the man that welcomed us into the restaurant, we got seated immediately. They have a very fun environment and modern fixtures. LOVE the outside patio lighting. Atmosphere is extremely pleasant. Booth seat isn't too worn in and still bouncy!   Got the #1- Enchiladas were delicious and served on a hot plate, had enough for leftovers, and would order again.  Margarita was 95% tequila-AKA fantastic and forced me to take an uber home. One tequila, two tequila, three tequila, uber... Ya feel? ;)   One negative experience was the waitress. she was not very friendly and never asked if we wanted drinks or appetizers. Ran away to the back with our IDs when we ordered a drink. Had to request through other employees to make orders and get her to the table. Never introduced herself.  In short, I enjoyed the atmosphere and food, we will be back again! Thank you!  PS please make taco Tuesday deals all day versus during happy hour times.

5JVzXzH_OlpzJdgGDpMLxw.text: My favorite chimichanga at a sit-down restaurant.  Many years ago I used to hit up La Pinata about once a week in its old location. It's one of the best casual Mexican restaurants I've ever been to. I recently got to sneak in before the lunch rush at their new location. It used to be Mary Coyle ice cream *sad face*.  The chimichanga is big. It's lightly crisped all around in deep fried goodness. The beef has an option of either machaca (really just shredded beef, no eggs in it) or ground beef. I prefer the machaca - tons of seasoned shredded meat that has never been dry or burned. Lots of red sauce but not quite drowned in it and a bit of cheese, lettuce, chopped tomato. The lunch special I had comes with rice, which was fluffy and good, and beans, which were very creamy topped with a bit of 2 different cheeses.  I've tried their tacos (good), tamales (average), enchiladas (good), "There's a taco in my burro!" burro (interesting but okay), albondigas soup (very good), chicken tortilla soup (okay, was always salty), Pinata Chimi (very good), machadilla (great), fajitas (average)...almost half their menu but at their old location. I'll have to come back with an update and try some of these again.  Their complementary chips are above average. The salsa is very chunky and tasty. The hot sauce is really good - hot in heat and lots of chili flavor.  The new interior is all windows towards the street with a front patio that can seat quite a few. Plenty of space between tables and booths. The bar is off to the side with about a dozen seats. They still have a couple of pinatas a the entrance but not nearly as many as before. It's nice. Parking could be an issue - they have about 20 spaces and when I left around noon, not a single spot was open.

rbRIoLeQg5FYRNnEtqPRtg.text: La Pinata is really good Mexican at a reasonable price for enormous portions. Come hungry. Also come with patience because they don't take reservations so there will most likely be a wait

xmhtCLK04FyAAEdl9PH_Tw.text: Warning: the food and service is still wonderful. HOWEVER, without telling us, they added an 18% tip to our check. We only had 6 people in our party. Plus the tip was AFTER taxes.   This is super annoying as we only noticed through careful review of the bill. The credit slip still had a place for a tip.   This left a really bad taste in our mouths.

YQoZbyPkhEyGH4ySsPjzDQ.text: Seriously good! Excellent service! I rate Mexican food on the basics....salsa, rice and beans. I figure if they can't do that right then there is a problem! Salsa was chunky (like I like) and flavorful. Beans and rice were delicious!  I got a cheese enchilada and beef taco. Beef was juicy and very good! Love their red sauce on the enchilada. Ordered the house margarita on the rocks! Very tasty!  I will definitely be back! Need to sit on the patio before it gets too hot!

_UUONdGpUlQSzsAt-w-LWw.text: I absolutely adore coming to La Pinata. I moved to the central part of Phoenix about six months ago from the west side of town, and at the recommendation of a good friend, came here. It's become one of my favorite places for Mexican food. The service is always great and attentive (I often choose to sit at the bar), and the food is to die for. Do yourself a favor and get the Mary Lou with red chile. Delicious!

HjC48d-2_UAVm2Zz7hJv5Q.text: Really good and LOTS of food for the price. The staff was wonderful and very timely. Pork was a little dry but the salsa is great and very spicy. They have a good happy hour to.

L5jJcEoYFjSr8McymkLBmA.text: I had not been to this location of LaPinata since they moved from the old location awhile back.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The new location (the old Mary Coyle shop) did seem like an upgrade to me and everything was great.  We were there on Sunday, June 19 arriving about 5:15pm.  The restaurant was busy and having a large party we had called ahead and the wait was not long.  The food was very tasty and hot.  But the best part of the visit was our server.  There were 9 in my party for dinner which will challenge even the best server.  Jose N. did a superb job with our table.  Just the right touch of knowing when to fill water, salsa, etc.   Kudos to Jose.  We look forward to dining with you again !!

L2vq0fLQ9g3i51spNGdzUw.text: Stopped in for an early dinner and had great service. One of only a couple of places that serves a really good chile relleno. Our waiter kept my water topped up and even turned the plate so the stem was facing away from me. Fresh modern decor, very clean and even has a flat screen TV in the mens room...

WbdaUTDLQgWv2JwUEG0vHA.text: Stopped by for happy hour with friends, glad I did! The food was delicious, the happy hour prices reasonable and the service was excellent. The portions size of each app was large enough to share with two people! Will definitely visit again

8aQi8Ul-Sp-8kpLGUIMbmw.text: Probably hands down my new favorite Mexican restaurant. The decor inside and out made me think of cafes in LA- very trendy and authentic. The food was so good- portions extremely generous and well priced for what you receive. Our server was excellent- and everyone around the restaurant helped each other out constantly. It's a bit of a drive, but we'll be back!

0OOEM_Z4Yx80WLJCsYC6Jg.text: We met here for dinner tonight with 24 members of our family, some who were meeting for the first time. We called ahead and asked to make a reservation to find that they don't accept reservations but they would accommodate us. They were incredible. They had tables prepared when we arrived, sat us immediately and took such great care of us. Thank you La Pinata for taking such great care of our family tonight and making it a family dinner to remember.

kWFOE-KC1eXEIuPRnf9x9w.text: So I was coming from Portland on a weekend trip and wanted some good Mexican food. Not nouveau, authentic, fancy, Mexican. Just honest to goodness tasty Mexican food. And a margarita or three. I did a lot of research and talked to many friends and finally settled on this place. Mostly it was the pictures of the beans and rice. I like my beans pinto and mashed. And I like rice that is not in the shape of an overturned bowl, meant to look fancy.    So we get there on a Friday night around 7 and I'm expecting a wait because the parking lot if filled. We enter through the back and immediately the fresh smell of peppers hits us and I know we've made the right choice. We were immediately seated at a nice table by the bar and it was our good fortune to have Gabby as our server. She was very sweet and had a can do attitude!  She recommended several dishes and we decided to start with the Mary Lou Christmas tree. It's basically a fat quesadilla served with beef and red sauce on one side and pork and green sauce on the other.  It was phenomenal and a ton of food!  Seriously we would have been full from that, but my wife and I love enchiladas so I ordered the red/cheese with beans and rice. She ordered the chicken ala carte.  Again, very, very good.  Great salsa and chips too.  We wound up taking at least half the food home and had for lunch the next day.    The margaritas were just ok, not fantastic but the service was A plus!  If you're looking for good, down home, tasty Mexican with great and friendly service with huge portions at a very reasonable cost. this is the place.  There, aren't you glad I did your research for you?

MncmOg9bTbbjMuF2HRwtwA.text: The salsa here is GREAT, as are the fajitas (and the patio!). The service here is normally excellent. Great lunch and dinner location!

pFeOs20onj28-VyYBxARaw.text: Our new favorite neighborhood Mexican spot! The green corn tamales and flautas were fantastic! The chips and salsa were fresh and excellent. Great job La Pinata! We'll see you again soon.

oFoSRwwOeMgbqhJbB0bPQA.text: This is absolutely the Valleys best Mexican food ever!!! The Chili Relleno is cooked to perfection with authentic white cheese! The beans and rice are the best I've ever ever had!! SO Delicious!! The bowl of Green Chili, again, is amazing!! And now I am on a mission to try everything on the menu. We have The YuccaTan Burrito  today... Yep, so good.  And the soft cheese crisp with tons of cheese. Tasty!  Service is always the best and fast!!

izjFc5SixeFEtdDJL0Px0Q.text: The new location of La Pinata is really nice... not sure why it took me so long to visit. The husband and I went to La pinata before I hopped on a plane out of town. PS they have hh here and the bar looks quite nice.

v2Jvwl-yePtQRm9H884xMA.text: This restaurant is crazy good. It's classic Mexican food with really high quality ingredients and a clear attention to detail by the chef. The plates come out piping hot, the refried beans are incredible, the cheese is real cheese, the lettuce and tomato garnish is so fresh... the salsa tastes like a grandma made it after years and years of experimenting with recipes... resulting in the most delicious salsa that is not too spicy but spicy enough.   The restaurant is also decorated beautifully. Not sure if it was custom designed, or was an effort by the owner - but it turned out gorgeous. No matter what time of day you go there, it feels like an intimate night time dinner in another place. Even the women's bathroom is designed beautifully (I love checking out restaurant bathroom design..)  Definitely a great date night spot as the food is delightful and the ambiance is spot on. A locally owned gem.

V68R9dRJnb_nxz9fZc5Npg.text: La Pinata has some of the best tacos in town. These are not the ever so trendy street tacos, these are your big fat loaded crispy tacos. The shredded beef is my favorite.  I've also tried the carne quesadilla and it was packed full of flavor and dripping with cheese.  Parking can be a pain, but it is worth circling the parking lot for the salsa and hot sauce!!

cQTlXpIGLFiu1PKlfDRTHw.text: We love this place. Been going since 2012 when they were at the old location. Still great, slightly more expensive at new location but still crazy delicious!

Lr2bs-2zAmaFJy-Va8bLRQ.text: This is the same great Phoenix staple relocated a little uptown. The resteraunt is smaller then the previous Osborne location but the interior got a great revamp.  EVERYTHING is A-Mazing here.  If you like chicken the tacos are great and is your a little more adventurous the Tio Pancho Pollo Connie Queso is peeeeerfect. The Ranchero burro is fabulous.  All of the staff are very friendly and many have been with this ace for years.  Support a family owned Phoenix tradition.

Xadyz7ARsYtZVqwpgkCNOQ.text: Not that the food was bad but the service... my husband and I have been going there since this location opened. Last time we went our experiences wasn't that great. So we hadn't been back in 6 months till today.  Our server was the bartender and we sat in the corner table. 1st he got my husbands order wrong... whatever,  towards the end of the meal I wanted another beer, he never came over, in fact I watched as he talks to a guy sitting at the bar ignoring us and the table next to us, so I went up and ordered my beer, he was quick to bring it out at which time we asked for to go boxes and our check... 15 minutes go by and he's still talking to the same damn guy sitting at the bar... by now I'm pissed. So I start to stand up to go talk to the owner, he sees me, runs over with the boxes, and again I have to ask for the check... I left pissed off and angry ... in my adult life I have never left such a bad tip for service, but ignoring your customers doesn't earn u a big tip. Here's a hit, if u don't have time to wait tables DONT, leave it up to the servers... WE WONT GO BACK

ajVk0zjX1fbdMUB5M-tPag.text: One of my favorite sit down Mexican restaurants in Phoenix. Always friendly staff. The spinach queso is delicious!

gzBILXzFDoPE9V8ZWZ78ew.text: I just tried to make a reservation for 15 people in March at 11 am on a Tuesday and was informed by a very rude female.  She said "we do not take reservations" and I asked if they would for 15 people and she said " I told you we don't take reservations" and hung up on me.  Is that the way you run a business?  Very poor customer service and I have no intentions of ever coming there or recommending it to my friends.

f6wWrUvpA7MR3ACtPjDB6g.text: Great atmosphere, very good service, hot food, by far the best red chili meat in town.

AOZWdQZ8pUL8yAOc0fRy0g.text: I cannot say enough kind words about the food at La Pinata. I share the same view as everyone else who has rang the praises about the amazing food. Now, I would like to take time to talk about the owners. I grew up at La Pinata in the 80's. I consider myself a close friend of the family. I remember Hope, the first lady aka founding mom of La Pinata. When I get to Heaven my hope is she will be willing to provide an endless supply of chips and salsa to me. I have known Roseanne, Romana and Peter since I was a little kid. I grew up with a kidney disease and eventually had a kidney transplant. I am an alumni in the Make A Wish Foundation in other words I was a Make A Wish kid. When Roseanne, Romana and Peter learned about Josh going on this Make A Wish trip to Canada they eventually threw a party closing down their restaurant to celebrate my life and raise money for Make A Wish. These people are some of the kindest people you will meet. I go there often and am always met with heart warming communication.

N15oxtrYJfwhetocHLJ3Bg.text: Ate there with my mother and sister for lunch. We'd all seen how busy the place seemed, and were a bit curious to see the restaurant that had taken over the old Mary Coils. I got the tamales lunch special. I'm usually not huge on tamales, they tend to be a little heavy, but WOW! The tamale was perfect! Light, but filling, a little sweet, and the perfect texture! I was in love! The server also got my Arnold  palmer just right, mostly tea and a little lemonade, fantastic! The tables were far enough from one another to feel private, but not too spacious. The taco that came with the tamale was really good, itself. The shell was homemade, which really made it perfect. The server was attentive, even though she seemed busy, and I must have seen 50 people either coming in or going out in the hour we were at our table. Parking is a little rough, but that's always been the case with that location, and as a Phoenix native I expected as much. Fantastic place, and I'll definitely be going back.

KYPZRw5ykmV7Q1b1jO8GPw.text: The manager is so rude. Get rid of her and I'll be back. Really lady...all I asked for was chips!!

zZfmAlpSvRR9Tq1uETsd8g.text: This food is sooooo yummy! After years of searching finally found may favorite spot to eat. I've been twice and ordered the pollo favorites dish, and the yucitan burrito. The house marga are huge and delicious. The ambiance is great, and the owner obviously knows what good Mexican food tastes like. Maybe they will be on door dash or uber eats soon for delivery. We can only get there on date nights... So very rarely.

fErqokbB1AEw3qc449VLdw.text: I was excited to place a carry out order after looking over the menu. We made our choices and called.  To our surprise, they refused to take my order and stated that they do not provide take out service - he stated they are dine in only.  What an odd decision for a restaurant to refuse extra customers without taking up a table.  It's a shame, but with all the Mexican restaurants to choose from, I'm not sure I will choose to dine in at this restaurant in the future.

s2HmcABJFXS702LikE_K3Q.text: Seriously meh. The beans were good, but none of us really felt that any of the other food was more than adequate. Fast and decent service, but without good food what have you got?

w8bIUC8PI54fFEy0m2Tqzw.text: This place was great!  I wasn't sure what to expect based on such mixed reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised.  Great food, attentive and friendly servers and a nice atmosphere.  We went for an early dinner on a Friday with our kids and sat on the patio and everyone was SO nice.  Best Mexican food we've had in a while and in a great place!  The only negative I can think of is the parking, which can definitely get tight as the restaurant gets more crowded.  Can't wait to go back!

IFnpm2l6G_sXDit1iDZOLw.text: I've been going to the old location since I was young and the food has never let me down! Went to the new location tonight and was so impressed!! Clean, bright, contemporary! I loved seeing the old faces in a new, bright place. They have the same food and the same love goes into that food. Recommend their combos to try a bunch of stuff at once, but also really love their chimichanga, fajitas and enchiladas. Old school Mexican - fatty, full plates!

UOZ4ShiLffv6FYFWDoCzrQ.text: Hugely disappointed in this new restaurant on 7th Ave after I'd heard a little buzz about it. Although they have seafood throughout the menu, we were informed they don't serve seafood because they have too small a kitchen to handle it. Ordered veggie quesadillas (which the server said were excellent) only to be told later they've removed it from the menu. They offer beef and chicken fajitas but can't hold it and call it veggie? Asked for fajita vegetables on the side which turned out to be a dish of sauteed onions. These guys are in one of the hottest areas for new restaurants in the city, so they better get it together if they're going to survive. By the way, the space is beautifully decorated. Perhaps they should've diverted more thought to the menu for non-meat eaters and (apparently) the kitchen size.

GiVWjpdQQmpqDkW9bwbaKg.text: Dear LJ, keep getting your beans from Sylvias,  that all she deserves! Oh and she will Charge you for the to go container!

AwKG7xwmBIARaW8sOYzEIw.text: This place is amazing! We walked in with 13 volleyball players, sat on their lovely patio with Matt taking such good care of us!  Good food , great service! Individual checks!

4BlDrkgx9HaunOijSMlaNQ.text: The menu has changed, and not for the better. They've changed the recipe for the ice in my tea. It never used to melt when the tea was gone. Now, it melts while I'm waiting for the tea to be refilled.

p3sJPLBPfbK774PU8p1B9Q.text: Dropped by for Lunch today at 2:15 pm.  Place was largely empty with  plenty of staff around. It took 20 mins  for my food and  later nearly 20 mins to receive check after my meal!. I asked to see dessert  menu,which was ignored twice by server.So no flan today !  Bottom line:Food was marginally OK ,Service was bad and this surprisingly  from an iconic  restaurant with 45 years in this  business . Emphasis evidently  is on bar offerings "Casa Margarita'  they call it.Try El Bravo  or Las Glorias or Los Compadres if you are after good Mexican fare in  North Central Phoenix.   FYI :I've lived in this neighborhood for 46 years so I believe  i know  my Mexican food.  I voiced my dissatisfaction to the Manager.No plans to return.

lxZXBZ6rmxPHAaKhKvdyhQ.text: The taco I had tasted like sawdust and enchilada wasn't much better. Sat at the bar and the bar tender never even asked how are meal was. We will never go back

WTS0l6DhTDUQClf1wR3RbA.text: With all the different Mexican restaraunts, La Piniata rates very high.  The guacamole is excellent, the service fantastic, and Angilo was an excellent server.

iCPlRjgwkZoaZzHKnpJiIA.text: La Pinata feels like a True, authentic Mexican restaurant in the heart of Downtown Phoenix. Parking is a little tight (as is most parking lots in that area). The restaurant itself feels large, but cozy. Well decorated with an outside area.  The Bentley margarita is amazing! The chips came out warm and the salsa had the perfect amount of spice. The server was very sweet and frequently checked on us.  We came earlier in the night, but by 5:30 pm it was packed. I saw many large groups. Overall a great experience. I would recommend to anyone in the area!

lSiPsplJwkCqU6sa4J74GA.text: One of my longtime favorites! We love family owned restaurants who care about quality food! Their new location is beautiful and very clean. Thank you Ya Pinata ; ) we look forward to every visit!

KRZv27uuczh7jtUdQlYkVw.text: We had a nice first experience at La Pinata tonight. We can in with time to try some things off the happy hour menu including the machaca street tacos, the house margarita and a beer. The tacos was piled high with delicious and fresh ingredients and were my favorite of everything we tried. It comes with a verde sauce that is to die for. My husband ordered the combo #4 which came with a red chili burro, crunchy taco, and tostada. We added a side of rice to try as well. He really liked his dish, especially the tostada. Our server Reese was very helpful, friendly, and quick. Based on the food, nice and clean atmosphere, and amazing customer service experience we will be back again soon!

Ux5W2JdfInvoEejsSFLVyg.text: My wife spends a lot of time in Phoenix with her job and took me here for early dinner.  All I can say is the shredded beef enchiladas and Spanish rice dish was off the charts!  Absolutely wonderful.  I liked the family type environment of the restaurant as well.  I sure hope to return again soon.  Highly recommend.

bbd4MyuwdVbleX8TS0MpDA.text: This place has been around forever. It's at a new location but it's still the same food I've loved for years.

Cyxr37HUD7LiHS0sGw6Lvg.text: Picked up a to go order. Service was quick. A suggestion for whoever is taking orders. If someone asks what is in the beans or rice, what kind of lettuce do you use, this should be known. If not, then find out., not just say ' I don't know 'and stand there like I'm wasting your time.   Better yet, include these items on the menu for those diners with allergies or sensitivities.   Roseanne(sp) was very helpful.

VL6ATtFbriIJ3pVfHVgILQ.text: I went to La Pinata when it originally opened but I didn't remember the food and service being so outstanding.  Nestled away in the the eclectic Melrose area. La Pinata really stands out. The decor is modern with a neutral pallete, but they still have traditional Mexican flare sprinkled in to add some culture. Like the three Dia Dos Los Muertos musicians pictured.  The bartender was incredibly friendly. She kept checking in on us, and was always at hand for refills. I also think it was a nice touch when she brought plastic ramekins for our to go food. The margaritas she served were great. They weren't too sweet. You could taste the tequila and skip the heartburn. She also made us beer backs since we like to create our own Beer-rita.  The food was awesome! Their salsa is chunky, and has just the right amount of kick to it. If you need more heat they also have the hot stuff on deck. The shredded chicken in my enchilada and taco was tender and juicy. The enchilada also had green chiles and salsa that made my mouth sing. I'm so over one ingredient enchiladas. The beans were rich and creamy, and the taco was packed with flavorful toppings. Loved every bite!

Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #5 chicken enchilada, chicken taco with rice and beans
Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Three amigos

i94NZNjCzfgvl7d2K8_wmw.text: This restaurant used to be in my neighborhood and I loved it. I am so happy for their new location, they are more exposed to more people.  Their staff is super friendly and the food is delicious.

ml1-bbsKNTCZYx_gfJJkLA.text: After having been regulars at the old location on 19th avenue for years (and having reviewed it a couple of times), we were excited to visit the restaurant's new home. We had great expectations, and we can honestly say that we were not disappointed whatsoever.  The new site, which was once the old Mary Coyle's ice cream parlor, has been transformed into this superb Mexican food restaurant.  Every aspect of the new place is simply head and shoulders above their old locale.The parking is more spacious and less scary, the bathrooms are modern and expansive, and the whole interior was well laid out and just evoked an upscale bistro look.  The food, which was the highlight of visiting the old location, was even better - if that was even possible. My wife commented that her chimichanga was really crispy on the bottom, and the meat was very well cooked and seasoned. And my #4 (Taco, Burro, and Tostada) was simply scrumptious. And the flan I had was simply superb. It tasted like it was even more freshly made than normal, just for us.  Even though I have rated them 4 stars in previous reviews, I had to give them 5 stars for the astounding service. Marleen, our server, was just amazingly efficient, friendly and courteous.   All the supporting wait staff, including the lady that saw my glass empty from all the way across the room and came over to provide me a refill, were just simply astounding in their attention to detail. I had never complained about their service before in the smaller locale, but they really did elevate their performance here at the new place.  Although we had to wait for about 25 minutes, even though we didn't have to really wait before at the old location, that did not detract whatsoever from our experience. However other regulars were complaining about having to wait. They obviously haven't been to eat in downtown Gilbert on Fridays and Saturdays and wait for an arduously long period for a table - anywhere there! That will certainly get you to appreciate the diminutive time spent waiting at this restaurant.  The location, the food, the environment and decor, and most especially the service deservedly receives 5 stars from us!   We are now truly unabashed fans of the sensational new location.

U9UxkmxvY34Min7ZGIICzw.text: We have been coming to this restaurant for many years. We have always had good service and the food is excellent! When we have out-of-town guests this is where we bring them for yummy Mexican Food!  We have had most of the menu items and enjoyed all of them. The green sauce is real "green chili" sauce and delicious. A big thanks to all of the staff for a delightful place to eat!

0q3h_wMmyVHWLw9UYsa_Ww.text: Meh. The food was okay at best. Ambiance and service were good. But the downside was that each plate of food could have fed 2-3 people. We didn't have a way to take it home as we are leaving in the morning. What an incredible waste. No one needs that amount of food. And for the quality of the food, the prices were astronomical.  Won't be back on my next visit to Phoenix.

lKWvvsDlxdNYOu5gcStAyA.text: This place is pretty good!  For starters we ordered the cheese crisp.  It was very cheesy and surprisingly not burnt like most places are.  Then I ordered the Tio Panchos pollo con queso.   Nicely seasoned and very tasty.  I even liked the refried beans which were "smoky" in taste.   My wife ordered the red burro, taco, and bean tostada combo meal.   She says she liked the red chili meat in the burro.  The only thing I feel they could improve on is their salsa.   Both the regular and hot salsas were lacking flavor and "punch".

TIV_PNc7keYRhrSW-ouFJw.text: Came to the new location (have been to the old one over a dozen times) for my Mom's Birthday because this is her favorite restaurant. The new place is really nice but I miss the old charm of the old building and decor. Our server was really nice, just took a while to clear plates etc. but they were extremely busy....I know why....because this place is amazing!! From the queso dip to the shredded chicken tacos to the Mary Lou (OMG!!) everything is excellent. I got a Devil Horn Margarita that was really good too. Their hot sauce and salsa are excellent and the complimentary sopapillas for my Mom's birthday were great.  Our server was really on point with the happy hour specials which really came in to great use.  We will be back for sure. Loved everything :)  PS...GET THE MARY LOU!!! Both green and red are absolutely phenomenal. This is a quesadilla filled with either red chile or green chile and it is stuffed and huge and did I mention AMAZING???!!! Spinach dip is a must too :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Horny devil margarita :)

BSxO-VvpLewYNVre2fcKng.text: I'm not very happy. I said I'm new to the area this is my first time here. I ordered margaritas it was happy hour for five dollars. They were very watered-down. Even for happy hour margaritas. I Waited till 3 o'clock to get the mini chimichangas for six dollars. I asked for the bill when I'm done and he charged me 895 for the chimichangas. And I don't like that he never brought my change. There was one other person there besides me. So it wasn't busy and I asked two times for my change. This is on a Monday shift change at 3 o'clock and that was the guy you came in at 3 o'clock. And he just went to long is the way ignored me and never gave me my change. I will never never ever come back here again I get over I told them I was waiting till 3 o'clock on a Monday to get the 3 PM to 6 PM happy hour chimichanga price for six dollars. I'm a woman by myself saying I'm new to the area and this is how you treat your guests? You're lucky you got two stars from me you should've gotten nothing you don't rip women off. I was on a limited amount of money before my next check I thought I do a little something on my only day off. And you have male bartenders that take advantage of women and their money and don't even bother coming back with their change. I watched him and I'm wondering when he's going to bring my change back and there's only one other customer there. I left about 3:45 PM it was very very slow so what the hell was this guy thinking I'm Giving him all my change? Do you know how many dollars that was? You guys are full of crap and your food was so average and the drinks were water down Go take a vantage of women they come in there by themselves

zm0FEbWTjQLR5uq5jxakoA.text: A Phoenix Mexican Food Classic. This is one of my favorite Mexican Joints in town, located in the Alhambra Village of Phoenix, AZ. Everything I've tried is delicious. It has a unique flavor style. The Beef Tacos and Green Corn Tamales are insanely good. Salsa is juicy and the corn tortillas chips compliment each other nicely. A good barometer to critique any Mexican Restaurant are the rice and beans, both very good. Highly recommended.

PL24jIXgTnwha_epsH2U4A.text: My family and I come to this restaurant at least once a week. This place has excellent service and you can always count on a consistent and authentic Mexican meal. If you are eating here for the first time I recommend the red Chile dinner plate or the red Mary Lou.

3h4p6tGtmDrDAS2SnMQEeQ.text: Loved it!!! Great food!!! TTV streamer btw for those of you fortnut players out there.

y6OHqsTGEmWcz1ki9_hrYw.text: Absolutely the best Mexican food restaurant!  We travel across town just for this great food!!  Service is fast and very friendly!

d1wkYJTu2cO7w7Q70C2lnQ.text: The new location is very nice but a lot smaller than the old location. The open dining room makes it very noisy at times. Chips were hot and fresh, salsa and hot sauce was tasty. The food came out in a timely manner served hot. The green chili chimichanga was good. Meat was nice and tender. Just wish they put more of it in the chimichanga. I felt I was getting a lot of tortilla per bite. Matthew was our server and he was awesome! Very attentive and checked on us regularly without hovering. Thank you Matthew for making our dinner experience even better.

qxKYrL5gZhn-3t0skRks9g.text: We had excellent service and the cheese crisp was fantastic! Thanks Matt for the being a wonderful server!

3ll2dcc5rM15jO42Ii7VsA.text: Ok, seriously, this place is awesome. The food is really good, the service is consistently excellent, and they make a solid margarita. I've been to this spot several times and it never disappoints. Their burritos are really good... You won't miss on this place and when the weather is nice they have a nice patio too.

U7xr1JFMjwMti3ZSfu5K4Q.text: Decided to take my dad here for a late lunch Friday afternoon. When we were seated they gave us chips and salsa and they were delicious!!! My dad had the Chili Rellenos, I had the bean and cheese burrito with the queso on top, my brother's gf had a combo plate and my brother had the taco in my burrito. It was all OUTSTANDING!!! The service was great too!!! So nice that this is also only a few minutes from my parents house too! I cannot wait to go back again!

PTB866By6srndSI5d7pi5A.text: Once again, La Pinata came through with a fantastic meal!   I was very happy to hear that my favorite item, Aunt Carlotta's mini tamales, is coming back to the menu!  Thank you so much for making my mom's 82nd birthday awesome.  We were there last year on your first day, too!

4NQ0Pg81OAzMqfIrAwHW6Q.text: We ordered 2 fajita Burros, some beans and some queso. The meat in the burritos was super dry. There was practically no peppers and onions so it was basically a meat burrito and not a fajita burrito and there was no sauce or anything in it. Overall super dry and bland. The queso tasted like Velvetta. Not impressed at all.

-xNIdLTs1B_YtCmuzeYWdA.text: The food is just as awesome as it ever was but there is a problem with an old school waitress. She was no fun at the old place and it continues today. I'm kind of recognizable so she probably has it out for me. Tonight I signed my bill with a note, I wrote, "Poor service equals poor tip, please apologize to the bussing staff". I felt terrible stiffing the kids but I felt I needed to express how I perceived her service. The other servers were working like rock stars and showing attention to each and every table.  To be True to the guidelines I will not mention names but many long time visitors probably know who I am talking about. It wasn't the half bowl of chips she started with or not noticing my tasty Michelada was empty when the food came and never dropped by to see if I might like another for the next 30 minutes. The next time we saw her was when we finished our meal and had to call out to get her attention for a check. I should have written, "Poor hospitality equals poor tip". When she brought out our food I asked her how the seafood place was doing that moved into their old location. She replied smartly that "She doesn't go that far south", making me instantly feel that she just disrespected the entire neighborhood that I have enjoyed for over 50 years. I know she has gone that far south, she worked there for years. I had no idea that moving 3 and a half miles would change people so much. Not a lot of love tonight, via con dios amigos... I can name a half dozen competitors that love my business and sell Tecate.

y3NhMQeYuZ56_8jld8ezlw.text: Some of the best Mexican food I've had in a long time. The pork carnitas and the shredded beef are astounding. So are the tacos and the enchiladas. We loved every bite! The guacamole is thick and fresh and plentiful along with the house made salsa and black beans. Can't wait to come back!  Even though it was busy the service was quick and kind and we had everything within moments.

6ib_D8zl40KXtJ-vMx47VA.text: Tried the new location. Place is much no we inside . Service was much better . They were very attentive . Food was good and potions were large and ftesh..my previous complaint was that the food was too salty. Rice and beans were over cooked.place was busy. The price was reasonable

IFcE-BUnI00SkZGV7J1Q2g.text: The food was most excellent, my first time here with some friends on a birthday. We got sat in a corner, five of us, waitress took our orders and we got served our drinks and didn't come back until we got served our food. I actually had to get up and go find an employee to get us more water.   I think we got full on ice, chips and salsa by the time we got our food, but it's all good, we got full all over again.   We didn't see our server again until we got our checks, next time I'm gonna ask we sit in the middle of the restaurant.  Again food was excellent, the service could use some improving. Pay attention, it's not a very big place.

JXbjPKQ2FeeFTz65rwefAQ.text: My family and I are always hunting around town looking for good spots to eating in hopes of finding that diamond in the rough. Let me tell you we didn't find much here, the ambiance was  cold in feeling and an eye sore, it was a clash of better homes/home and garden meets  Santa Fe living room... nothing to do with good Mexican food. Anyways.... To the point... The food was just ok. Nothing I haven't

nJ-wYr7-HlIb2bFCxSKnGQ.text: I can't get enough of this place. This is the same La Pinata from years before, but the new location is gorgeous. I'm one of those people who always orders the same thing when I go out, but when I try something here, it's always a winner... the Machacadilla is my new religion. The bar here is worth the trip alone. The 3330 is the best margarita I've ever had. Honestly. And the Mis Padres margarita swirled with chambord is also aces.

E1udzKkDbxrt_My4-UrihQ.text: I've always loved this place, love their new location on 7th, food is always good. Guacamole is freshly made,  try crispy cheese crisp,  always a good choice.  Flautas    seem to be handmade.  My boyfriend had ranchero machaca burrito,  sucker was huge!  Service was good, Friday night the place was packed.  I heard one family balk at the 20 min wait and said they were going to Sylvia's across the street! Don't do it, this place worth the wait! I would not eat Sylvia's, not worth it!

co6t13SnTS-gvUS67E3VaQ.text: Oh, La Pinata. How I loved your old location and how I loathe the new one. Suddenly, a charming old school Mexican food with amazing food, margaritas, and servers turns into a loud, chaotic cafeteria experience with a parking lot far too small to accommodate the droves of people who (thankfully) didn't know about the other location. While the food is still the best Mexican in the city and the margaritas on point, coming here has become more of an annoyance than a joy depending on the day. I'm sure you've gotten a lot of new business, and I'm happy for you for that... but this location stinks!! It has become another loud, trendy Phoenix restaurant restaurant with no unique attributes.

vK7bHgq5xxSHcNogsvcZGg.text: Very fast and friendly service! Salsa was delicious! Ordered the Charbroiled Steak Quesadilla and they knocked it out of the park, huge serving for an appetizer! Guacamole was great, chunky and fresh! Chicken fajitas were enough for two people. Happy hour drink menu was excellent! Very swanky decor and clean on the insane with no annoyingly, loud music. Bar area is really cool and modern! Great place to go with anyone. Will definitely be back!

mJPss7mz7-2k1mKiua_vQQ.text: Service wasn't bad at all, I actually like the decor and set up as well. The food just wasn't very good. I think eating authentic Mexican food in AZ may have spoiled my taste buds.

UwpN270055-uCOC7Z0tjyw.text: My life long favorite restaurant. Though the meat varies, my usual is a burro (currently with machaca) enchilada style with a side of rice and I have not found another restaurant anywhere that makes this better. Also lots of love for the staff who have been like family.

4H2Fs-FaxODiAcVI4AY-_A.text: My go to Mexican food in Phoenix. Traditional Mexican is my favorite and that is exactly what they serve up. Great tacos, nachoa, quesadillas, rice and beans. And of course Modela on tap.

tOpVm8dxMBn8eLlB3n6VDw.text: Why is this place busy? ? ? We stopped because of all the cars. A lot of cars must be good right? I don't know what the attraction was. The food wasn't bad.....it just wasn't anything special. I have had better many, many times. And all the cars? Really?

vv1PxkzI-J6V6byZ2bnZaQ.text: Coming through town and stumbled upon this place. About a 15 minute wait, but it was well worth it. Their pina margarita was excellent. I had the Machaca dinner, my husband got a carnitas burrito, and my son, the Mexican Short Stack. We were all very happy with our meals and the service. Definitely recommend this place!

JkqsI7EAoSuOb3BGMdQuoA.text: My husband and I love La Pinata! We were even there twice this week.   Whether you are sitting at the bar or at a table, you will receive great service! When we sat outside, our server was energetic and attentive. The drinks and food came out quickly and were delicious. When we sat at the bar, the chips and salsa were served promptly and so were our drinks.  If you like margaritas, I highly recommend the margarita made fresh and upgrade the tequila to Hornitos. Oh my gosh, so good!   For food, we ordered a kids meal which was a great size and price. I ordered the Salad Carbon with grilled chicken. That jalapeno ranch is delightful too! My husband ordered the Tacos Del Mar and was very satisfied.   Also, one of my favorite things about La Pinata is their decor. The little pinata that serves as their mascot is just the cutest. Also, no matter where you sit you will be comfortable.  Check this place out, it's pretty awesome!

Ld4T7tFm7GM2MHmNkXtmzA.text: I am so disappointed in this location.  They took over the old ice cream shop that used to be here.  Food is good but over priced.  Still, good food.  This has happened in multiple occasions.  Called to place an order, person on the phone asks me 2-3 times what it is.  I clarify my order and they repeat and give me the time frame.  20 mins.  They sound busy so I give them 10 extra to be safe.  We arrived to pick up our order.  It's wrong.  They ask us to wait for them to remake it.  Businesses, if you make a mistake, and your customers have to wait while you fix it, a good practice is to redeem the experience in some way so that they return.  Sadly, this has happened too many times and we're done.  Adios la pinata.

bQ2ofZHu0JYOtf8W6ugKgw.text: Came to pick up some take out and it was really good. We ordered a taco combo and enchiladas combo. I like that they included a lot of salsa. They included chips too which was a nice bonus. Will definitely come back.

Seems to be getting more popular everytime I visit.  awesome margaritas,  cheese crisp to start, Chile relleno wow! Everything we order is just too good. If I could eat here every day I would.  Best food eeeeeeever !!

E7YfUeFmtpGgZzSzOpQesQ.text: As you can see from the pictures it's white people Mexican food. The service is fine and the people are nice, but the food is nothing special. In my opinion, if you're going to have a Mexican restaurant in AZ it better be good, but there are a lot of white people around so it makes sense that it's popular. Just don't go if you like authentic Mexican food- that's my advice.

Y1pH5ezCftCOTlzTbBihBw.text: Overall a good experience. I'd give La Pinata 3.5 stars if half stars were possible. The supremo nachos with half machaca beef & half chicken were good and plentiful, but the chips were a little soggy.  I suggest skipping the chicken as the beef had much better flavor.  We also had a combo plate with a cheese enchilada, green corn tamale, and a guacamole taco.  All were good. It's way too much food for me though.  The tamale and taco were great the enchilada was average mainly because the sauce was just average.   Service was good. Good atmosphere.  We dined inside , but the patio looked nice with a fire.

a1eUXUGPW85DgTLCsvKhaA.text: Me and my girlfriend love this place and have made it a tradition to either go there and eat or take out for dinner on Sundays. Usually, we get excellent service, but today we had a server that either was having a very bad day or was just not very good at his job. He wasn't very attentive and my girlfriend had to shout at him for a box as he was walking away with our check, which he walked by at least five times prior. The classic frozen with a chambord float is my favorite and they do it well here.  The salad carbon was off the chain- served on a big platter and worked for me as 2 full dinners.

We love the Green Chili Chimichanga. It comes with Sour Cream and Guacamole ( homemade) in tubs so you can control how much you use. So much deliciousness!!! Great Salsa too!! Great servers, great music, great food! We won't wait so long to return!

Now I have a second favorite dish here & I'm excited to try something else next time!

gV80amW6z0U6Kp8OQL5XVg.text: With 21 check-ins to date,  I best write an update raving about our go to place for fajitas and Mexican pizza half beef half chicken. Yes, it's still great and I think I can say we are regulars. We love the staff and they take care of us like we are family, they are so good to us. This is our regular spot for day dates and weekday happy hours. Will be in soon for check-in 22. mmmhmmm.

glqrjpWmYVWooMcc_pQIVA.text: My favorite!!!!! I frequent La Pinata mostly every week! Their frozen margarita topped with a Chambord Liqueur floater is my go to starter, afterwards I chose their always fresh Modelo Especial on tap! Peter, one of the owners, is a wonderfully great person! ALWAYS have some of the best conversations with him! Definitely would recommend La Pinata to a friend, and will continue to come here again and again!

3UldpkhGgi1_lcrZ9hyeLA.text: So third visit. Last week. Decided to just stop in for some margaritas at the bar. ( Thur nite) Sat down. It was only 8:30pm.  We weren't even acknowledged. I mean.... no hello.... nothing. There were only 4 others at the bar. Not a lot of tables occupied.  Finally I got the gentleman's attention. Yes.... we would like 2 margaritas please.  Oh.... okay. ( like why do you think we are here)? Put them down. A young lady went to hand us menus. No thanks... we are just having drinks.  You would think we did something wrong once we weren't eating  That was it.... never addressed us again. We easily could have had another one.... but no thanks. I'll go someone else.  I mean.... $20 for 2 drinks.... you could have made a killing on us.  There are people that eat and drink water only!  We normally do both!!  I hate to say it.... but I think we are done with LaPinata. Too bad.  I don't expect a red carpet..... but a simple acknowledgement would be swell.

ZV7mGpc4-dVDXoMykpq_ww.text: We went there on a Tuesday night for a family dinner. Granted we had 14 people, but the receptionist Was very rude. Don't think he wanted to be there that night. He told us it would be a very long wait. Yes they were busy but he was very rude and not helpful. We ended up leaving and went to Macayos. Got seated right away.  Had great service and the food was. Great. Unfortunately I missed out on la Pinatas great hot sauce.

yuCIO6qyGaijhSQJnckH2A.text: Came into town to visit my mom and had a craving for Mexican food (I'm 7 months pregnant). My mom told us she usually goes to Sylvia's across the street, but I wanted to try La Pinata since it was a new spot. Our server was Daniel and he was so sweet and very easy to talk to. The food was so good! I had the create your own burro and the red sauce is divine. My husband got the mini chimichangas and loved them. Daniel kept coming back to check on us, fill up our waters and spark up some small talk. My husband and mom ordered margaritas and I was so jealous because they looked so good. This is definitely a new and upcoming place in Phx. We are in town for a few more days and will definitely be coming back before we leave!

4K-_hIKI_-uuC6cGEaESFg.text: Food just OK. Four of us went all ordered different meals. All just OK. Looking for something crave-worthy. Beer was cold and served in frosty mug. Had to ask for chip refill. We liked the ambience and location is perfect.

0hynvGvMAo9S8wubDMzjoA.text: I'm only on the salsa and it's just as fabulous as always. I love the new location and the decor is beautiful. Open 5 days and the place is standing room only. To the previous negative commentor, they are way took busy to fill an order for beans. Go across the street....you'll be angry lol.

_jhQJqBs6uvP6rwyscieJQ.text: Love the new location even though I am nostalgic for the old.  Same great food they have had since the 70's(the best green corn tamales I've ever found in a restaurant.)  Cheese crisps are actually crisp!!!    Love that the new location has outdoor seating which the old one lacked.  The restrooms are a great improvement too.    Their enchilada and sauce is closer to the great stuff we got back in the 60's and 70's than on most cheese enchiladas in restaurants in recent decades (deep red/rust sauce, tasty cheese with tiny chopped onion, wrapped in good corn tortillas, topped with chopped black olives and white crumbled cheese)....not the same, but closer than most restaurants.  Shredded beef tacos are always good.  Salsa is good and they can bring algo mas picante.  My husband likes their machaca dinner and rarely strays from it.  We will be able to go more often now that they are way closer to our home.

hsXacYShpj0mgGXAl6Gs2w.text: Service was outstanding and the food was delicious. The enchiladas and tacos are phenomenal. Would recommend a visit!

7E55DI1yWHdqsb355F3LyQ.text: The new place is nice and new.  Parking is a problem  unless you get there early.  Tha salsa was not spicy. Chips were marginal , a little on the cold side . I had green chili burro and  a taco . Green chili was salty. And the meat overcooked.  Taco had too much cheese . Combinations  were a little pricy. RICE was firm. Service was a little  slow . For the neighborhood  I prefer Los compadres

HHQccQOVLpP0vKnweTkeRw.text: Nice chill spot , customer service is good, looks nice in there, has a modern Mexican twist with a lil razzle dazzle the food was OKAY could be better , the area is nice , the location is perfect  good parking

dc0mBPHLb03kGr4fnfNeoA.text: Contemporary setting meets traditional Mexican cuisine. This place is great. The surroundings are "modern Mexican" with a traditional color palette and accessories with an updated urban design. Food was amazing and served in generous portions. The chicken nachos were completely loaded with chicken, cheese, pico, etc... Chimichanga was huge, smothered in sauce, and came with sour cream and guacamole. We had a large party  and the service was fantastic. Al the waiters pitched in together to provide excellent service.

BsG61yxaRUZmheuTdeiCmw.text: We had lunch and the place was popular and fairly busy. We both had lunch Chimis and the green chili beef was very good. Great faculty and patio too

EjgVd5Q1YWS98AhLOs9-Hw.text: New place is a lot smaller, decorated upscale. So it would seem they would be more in that mode.  We would of liked if they put out small plates so you can put you salsa on the plate instead of all of us dipping from the same salsa bowl. They are tight on the chips, they come in a smaller bowl. When we asked for more chips the much older waitress seem annoyed. Also when you ask for an order to go why not put the container in a bag other restaurants do.  It was ok but I wouldn't drive out of my way to go back.Other Mexican restaurants are more customer friendly and food just as good or better.

46ehd_h6hdL2x8Jfj74wpA.text: I guess no place can get it 100%. It is crowded and we've always had to wait. No big deal for the right place. We like the patio though the fake grass wall is weird. Like many others I suppose, we have a favorite place for one dish and another place for another dish. We've only been there twice, each time we were a party of four so we tried several different dishes. Their cheese crisp is standard (not as good as Los Compadres if you like a really crispy tortilla which we do), tacos were just okay, the enchiladas were a bit better, the salsa was ordinary, beans seemed canned and the tamales were downright boring. The best dishes we had were the Pollo Azteca and the Pork Carnitas. We'll probably go back occassionally for those since they are walking distance from our house but when we want really good Mexican food, this is not our place.

RZqT3vYeoS6HbEsOKKX8fw.text: Solid food, generally good flavor.  They kick the food out the kitchen in a very timely manner!  The pollo con queso Chimi is very good.  Stay away from the chile relleno if you grew up in NM like me, you'll be disappointed!  Not a real green Chile.  It's a stuffed Anaheim Pepper, that's far from stellar!  Otherwise, excellent service, like the new location on 7th Ave!  Will go back and stick with what I know to be good.

-RMry3MDnqj3xU1iDXVOqA.text: Absolutely love this place. I have been coming here since I was 3 and still havent found a mexican food place I like more. Miss the old building but the foods still good.

8S-YjXQ5fx_LUaL5aSvNoQ.text: Excellent food, chips and salsa.  My favorite is the Carnitas Burro, best I have every had.  I would give them 5 Stars but they are not offering take out.  Hard to go out and eat with the little ones.  I have been going to this place for over 20 years, new location is very nice.  UPDATE, they have take-out now, all is complete, we order from here almost every week, excellent food!

w9uj4a-gbUp_2NuGvwzx8w.text: Never went to the old location as it looked kinda shady. This location couldn't be any different. Very well decorated, the ambiance is top notch. The service was awesome, everyone working together. The food was awesome, I got their famous chimi and it didn't disappoint. The only thing that's weird is they opened up across the street from an established Mexican place, Sylvia's. That's kind of a dick move, but oh well let the people decide I guess. Anyway I highly recommend this place.

bDyiqyQVWJtEliEWGEBwmA.text: My coworker took me here for lunch a couple of months ago and it's now my favorite Mexican restaurant in the area.  I absolutely love the enchilada sauce that they have.  I've only gone for lunch, but the portions are large for a lunch menu- I cannot clear my plate.

J2c-d8sOFEGxqhinK45tSQ.text: Love me some authentic Mexican good. With the pipping hot plates the food is delicious. The new location is always packed. Great chips and salsa and I recommend the beef enchiladas.

EpcasNnhJQuJbYJC6tYL4A.text: The food is pretty good. I had chicken fajitas and I really enjoyed them although the chicken isn't sliced up, it's just a chicken breast. The portions are huge. Overall, I enjoyed my meal and the service was okay.

2sgwLWaKZkwb_kXEm2TfvA.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this place as I ride by it all the time. Finally gave it a try. The food was delicious and affordable Cool vibe and a great ambiance. They give you ample portions. Definitely worth the $$$.

CNFd748TLnxFyaHvwOfYjw.text: The NEW La Pinata is a major disappointment !!  This is a great place if you like your food served tepid.  The WAS one of our favorite haunts ( 200+ visits over a number of years at the old location).  Since their move in October 2015, things have deteriorated.  The service is now mediocre and slow.  The noise level is profoundly louder.  The food is not served hot.  The lunch special menu variety is greatly reduced.   Our LAST visit at the new location was today (our third attempt for a satisfactory experience at the new location):  We asked our waiter to make sure our order was served hot.  The food was barely warm.  We opted to take our food home to heat it.  When we asked for a container to take salsa home - the waiter informed us that the charge would be 75 cents.  We were insulted, especially since we had unsuccessfully asked our waiter three times for our first salsa refill.  In spite of all of this the restaurant seems busier - since the move.   I am truly happy for the owners - but WE will not be returning.   Three strikes and you're out.   There are too many better alternatives.  For example: Jordan's Mexican Food on 7th Street has vastly superior service, good food, and is pleasantly quiet.  It is only about 5 minutes away from the new (not improved) La Pinata.

PcwUTULJXJb7-V2QMIPO9g.text: So far we have tried La Pinata twice, and have really enjoyed it! Cool design inside. The food has been excellent, one of our new favorite Mexican restaurants. So far we've tried the fajitas, the Chile relleno, the chimichanga and another chicken dish, but can't quite remember the name. All the dishes taste authentic without being the generic Mexican food you sometimes find in AZ.

uYfbNE6N1dLT1ZvNcouDUQ.text: Tried to get in here several times and couldn't. Now I see why. It's excellent. I had the salad carbon with marinated steak. My wife had the machada burrito and mh daughter had the black bean tostada. We all loved it. Plenty of food as well. Good atmosphere and service.  A new favorite.  You won't be disappointed unless you can't get in.

Az-enaFbfZ6onX8Z6l60ng.text: Currently studying for a rather important and daunting licensing exam and decided to take a break and get out of the house for dinner with my husband. We just moved here a few weeks ago and decided to try La Pinata for the first time! The decor was really cool, and the porch looked like a fun place to hang out and eat, but it was sort of chilly so we ended up sitting inside. I ordered a mango house margarita to drink. When it arrived, it was most definitely not mango (it was lime), but I was enjoying it, so I told the waitress not to worry about having it remade and to just remove the surcharge from our ticket for the flavoring. Apparently the manager wouldn't have that and said I either had to have my drink remade or I was paying for the surcharge. So, I had the drink remade. It was right the second time. I worked in food service in varying capacities for several years and would have never, ever said that to a customer, though. When our chips & chili con queso got to the table, there was a long black hair attached to one of the chips (I'm blonde, my husband has light brown hair). I didn't say anything because the impression I was given when I complained about the margarita was that the manager would likely think I was just looking for a write off on my ticket. When our food arrived, it was great. Not a single problem and everything tasted fantastic. When we were finishing up, though, an upset employee (manager maybe?) busted into the kitchen and LOUDLY (loud enough for the entire main dining room to hear and turn around) said: "if you guys don't start cleaning off the f****** tables outside...". Very, very unprofessional to use profane language when dealing with employees or coworkers, and even worse to say it loud enough that customers can hear. Our server, Lindsey, was great. She did everything right! Management, on the other hand, could use some worK. Certainly not the experience I was hoping for tonight.

WnKyVwgFumcyImhsAXt1Fw.text: All I can say is BEST MEXICAN RESTAURANT in Arizona. Service, food and atmosphere are impeccable. We love the queso dip, machacadilla and grilled steak quesadilla.  The Mis Padres margaritas are amazing.  So glad La Pinata's new location still has the family vibe and the same staff and recipes!!  THE BEST!!

ZPlTvvB8pLCJ0Cytg1U8Qg.text: I don't normally write reviews but I just dined here for lunch with my mom and two children (5 and 7) and I don't understand why it's so busy. Don't waste your money, go somewhere else, especially if you have younger children with you. We waited about 10 minutes once we were seated to get our drink order. Then we waited another 15 minutes for those drinks to come and for our order to be taken. Once our food arrived the waitress never came back to fill our drinks or ask how everything was. Nothing special about the food itself. My mom and I both had bean burrito enchilada styles. Which I thought for $7 was kind of expensive because it was a large flour tortilla with a small amount of beans and bland sauce. I had to put a bunch of salsa on it to give it some flavor because all I taste was the tortilla. Also it was recommended by the waitress to wait to give my children milk until the food arrived so I thought okay, sure. However by that time they had drank water and didn't really drink the milk (which happened to be $2.50 for a children's milk!). With all of that being said we'll never go back. There are much better places around. Bad service, bland food, and expensive for what you get.

q9H-eNG67tQE9N19CwUgCg.text: The place doesn't even do take out orders!!!! Avoid at all cost if you're hungry looking for food. Fail.

Kve1y5DJV0hqqsdmklCIPg.text: Steak fajitas are amazing and by far the best in town!  I am definitely a fan of the old location,  loved the old school feel to it.

sKvUNh5gYvB6gGsJeAOZPg.text: Wow.. I cant tell you how angry I left this place. They don't care if they made a mistake (seat someone else in front of you after waiting 10 minutes). All you get is attitude even from upper management. Won't be going to this place any time soon.

FhqQNumHQzT3jW710HR43A.text: Authentic delicious Mexican food with trendy, ketchy decor! And a great outdoor patio that is dog friendly and oh so nice now that the weather has gotten so nice.  We come here often and have never been disappointed in the quality of the food, generous portions, and friendly service of the staff.  100% of the time we take part of our meal home so the value equates closer to two meals for the price of one.  My husband always orders the same thing, and has for years, the Carne Macacha dinner!  I i'm more adventurous and have tried just about everything on the menu and it's all been delicious. I've never been disappointed in one single bite. Guacamole is outstanding! I had the chicken tortilla soup on our last visit and it what is hearty and delicious! It is topped with fresh avocado and tortilla strips and cheese and is even better than mine and that's saying a lot!  If you want nonsense real deal Mexican food, this is the place!

9hFT062v5h74c7NTGGH5bQ.text: Visited there new location for the first time love the new look and plenty of staff to make sure you are well taken care of. The food is great, the location near, the atmosphere friendly and easy going. Will definitely come back

Xw92twYpnhQ37gctzvd-OA.text: Very rude management!!!!! Discriminates against the gay community. Will make you wait longer for a table if you are a member of the gay community. When management was asked about this practice their response was "we'll work on it".

Kgi6ZGRhorBfHpPdhmkNdA.text: Still the best Mexican food in the State but parking, wait time & service is not what it used to be compared to the original location. Not to mention the lack of carryout now - I'm assuming due to the limited parking. If you're getting tired of waiting DON'T let them talk you into sitting at the community table! They say no reservations but apparently that doesn't apply to everyone. We saw a table for 5 + 2 high chairs in holding for over 30 min. When I asked about it they said that there was a party of 7 ahead of us but obviously they weren't there so clearly they do take reservations. Once we agreed to go to the community table then they divided the table up for two other parties of waiting customers . Go figure! I still won't eat Mexican food anywhere else but it's unfortunate that the customer service has declined so much.

C0w6ivyrIGVlbFlywS50Dg.text: our family favorite!  love this place.   The food is fabulous! great staff,  very clean

HKY13XBstUwXhEue-z5dnA.text: I have to say that this is my VERY favorite restaurant. We go there several times a week. We have been going there since the original La Pinata opened in 1970 and have never been disappointed. The food is wonderful ... service is attentive ... beautifully decorated. Take-out is now available and they are also doing Bar Specials, in addition to Happy Hour.  I love this place!!!!  PS  Try the frozen Blood Orange Margarita! My favorite!

oZ3EecF4FPDKg2SgHl5g5A.text: Outstanding food!  I had what equated to the sampler of everything when I was there.  Since I live in Ohio, it may be a few months before I fly out again to see family.  I will be sure to stop in when I arrive again.  I've been talking about my experience in Phoenix and this restaurant ever since I returned home.

c7rpQEaP1_gXz_CtGpxJNA.text: Food is fantastic!! Love the pork carnitas! Location is beautiful and friendly staff. Very happy with my experience

duXMltfK_SIE3L0HvWU1FQ.text: Went on a Friday. It was very crowded during happy hour. We were not offered a happy hour menu and had to wait 10 minutes before our server came by to offer drinks. We were just there for drinks and appetizers. The taquitos did not have much beef and the beef was extremely dry and not flavorful. I am not sure if the hype is because this is a new restaurant but I do not know how it stays so crowded.

JUZPWivaVdN4AMCI6qCoIQ.text: Daniel gave us great service with his cute hair. They kept the chips coming I was afraid I'd be to full but when the food came I made room. If I lived in the area I'd be sure to come here more often. I'd suggest you try the chimmy minis BOMB!!!!

lju99bZ0xqZf1fsz-Q34bQ.text: Went on opening weekend so they were out of a few things.  Still trying to figure out the kitchen.  Forgiven.  However what we did order was fantastic and the owners, waitress, and overall ambience was 5 star!  Fun hip place, clean, modern- made us feel like family there.

8f6ahFhjUDSRj5p03k-vPQ.text: Been here before. Definitely will not be back again!!!. Even though its taco Tuesday,  the staff was not ready for the crowd. Bad service, food quality has seriously gone down. Server just disappeared when time for check. Better get their act together !!!

kpJbtqBzIX33VrByhTuhVw.text: What a little treasure!!!  Nice atmosphere, attentive staff, great service and the FOOD!!!  Authentic Mexican food and lots of it!!  Their portions are amazing!!!  So delicious. Highly recommend this place. Another point to the positive, the prices are very reasonable.

GeSpApOL2frEJW6m_ZfVfQ.text: My new favorite local restaurant! I love La Pinata for its cozy atmosphere, festive decor, attentive service & authentic food. I've come here solo & sat at the bar but also brought different friends here. This is my go-to spot for Albondigas Soup ~ super delish, nurturing, huge portions. My friend had Pork Carnitas and raved about them. Consistently yummy and always friendly/hospitable. I can't wait to try more dishes from their menu & initiate more friends into the La Pinata experience :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La Piñata&#39;s tree w/ Frida Kahlo tree topper!

i7ADXISXvpG-5WpMfQ8DxQ.text: This is our go-to Mexican food place. Our family originally started going to La Pinata when it was located downtown.   Although we miss the retro 70's decor at the original location, this location is closer and the design of the space is modern, bright, cheerful and very pleasant.  And there are lots of booths which we love!  The food is consistently good and the service is always great. We love the fresh made you-call-it margaritas (no mixer, just fresh lime juice). Get it with the Hornito's tequila. Although they are $10. But well worth it.  Our favorite food items:  Chimichangas Machaca - anything Cheese Enchiladas Shredded Beef Taco Cheese Crisp (get it soft, not crispy)  Their chips and salsa are good and complimentary.

cD5gTF3CGgjWBQE3a2SvGA.text: Food was great. Had lunch menu which was quite a bit. I had burrito, just too much red sauce put on top, like just a little. But it was great. Clean inside & comfortable

FngzuP6drDHvvZR8KgIhrA.text: The ambience was great, so was the salsa, and that was about it. Ther green chile tastes like canned meat in weird sauce (just take it off the menu, for the love of anything remotely resembling Mexican food!) And the taco was just edible.  I'll add a second star for good beans and rice, actually.

yTekE5V6qwbDVGKjrzP77w.text: Love this place. We had between us: Chicken tortilla soup, chicken chimichanga, chili relleno and spinach enchilada, quesadilla and everything was yummy. The prices are crazy inexpensive and the wait staff are attentive without being intrusive. Margaritas I hear are good too.

EKQPCMdvWhCNXHZ9hoP09Q.text: Arrived at 7:05 PM and regardless of how. Yay it was their waiters and waitress were on a certain pace where you found no gaps in their service.  I was pleased with their food. My palette is delicate and must say that this place was not what I expected. I e thing I did not like was the fact that a restaurant named La Pinata he no Horchata which was not a big deal, I w tea and water did the trick. I will definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La Piñata

RrNe7gQ5FvPWQ2S9jN1KQQ.text: Ok y'all. It's time to let you in on a not-so-secret secret. La Pinata is my new favorite food. Period. Some tips: make a reservation if you're going during prime dinner hours. I've enjoyed this food several times now, and have been known to speed walk from the parking lot to beat other patrons to a table. To be fair, they were speed walking too. Next tip: try to be seated in Jessie's section if possible. She's super nice, has a great smile, and will help you regain your faith in humanity. Tip her well, she deserves every penny. Next, order food. Seriously. Any food. No one I know has disliked anything. My personal favorite is the Steak Picado. Seems easy enough, but I have yet to find anyone who makes it better. Include a Bentley Margarita if you imbibe. Lastly: grab a mint on your way out. They look like peppermint but they're the buttercream wedding mints of your childhood dreams.   I'll see you there. And don't burn your mouth on the beans. Mmmm.

GcbR9ot8yZeAqxgVAfWy5Q.text: Best kept secret in Phoenix. Love the service and the food! Beer is served in freezing cold glasses!

RVhIOou0zUzrf2jfrjUy5A.text: I never visited the old location, but I love the way they have redone the old Mary Coyle's building on 7th Avenue and turned it into a great, upscale Mexican food restaurant. We visited with a group of seven people and had an excellent experience. Service was fast and attentive and the food was excellent.  Between us we tried everything from the carne machaca dinner to the shrimp enchiladas suizas, the enchilada combo plate, and the chimichangas. (As a side note, its funny that La Pinata also lays some claim to the chimichanga as I'd thought the debate was strictly between Macayo's in Phoenix and El Charro in Tucson who both claim to have invented the dish. La Pinata is careful not to claim to have invented the chimichanga, but they certainly play up their connection to it).  Everyone was very happy with the food they had and most of us went home with enough to eat again the next day for lunch.  Now that they are in my neighborhood I have no doubt that I will be returning!

Sutfa4Pa-BEgCOgRJuuORw.text: Exceptional! Food is always on point. Been here for my third visit and have never been disappointed. The chimichangas are amazing! The enchiladas are amazing. Even the fish tacos are amazing! Always well maintained and always clean from the outside to the inside. If you love Mexican food and a great dining experience then you HAVE to try this place! During the cooler months, sitting outside is a treat with having patio heaters. Even when it's warm out they have misters to keep you cooler. The lighting creates a unique and warm dining experience. All in all I'll continue to eat at this establishment. You've gotta try it!

jJoL47AQY_-hbKCCRjggog.text: The first thing I noticed was how nice of a job they did with the remodel of the interior and patio (from former business). Our family went in at around 9pm on a Saturday. Although they were closing in an hour, they greeted us promptly and welcomingly. Chips and salsa were brought to our table immediately along with waters all around. Anthony G helped us with our selections and checked in on us about every ten minutes. I was blown away by the service he gave. I was amazed at how quickly the food came and how nice and hot it was. Our orders were: Taco Salad (perfect size in a tall deep fried tortilla bowl), Chicken Quesadilla (huge), taquitos (for the little guy), and a relleno, taco, tostada (combo). My Green Chile used for the relleno was actually hot, spicy and something to talk about (they are not always this good). Everyone enjoyed the meal, but the best thing we had was dessert. Sopapillas... so soft, so warm. With powdered sugar and honey. Mmmmmm! We waited too long to try it, But now it will become one of our regular spots!

Z2MA5GFnWKpOyJzMcmnFAQ.text: Love this place! They have great chips and salsa. Definitely one of my go to Mexican places. Avoid dinner time on the weekends, you will wait awhile!

zTvgyXeLTk8ulM729ieCdg.text: I wish I could give this place 5 stars. The food is always really good and fast. The reason this place is receiving 3 stars is the service and the cooks.   Every time I order my food, I ask for no garnish. Not too big of a request, I just don't want a side salad with my Mexican food. It never fails, they GIVE ME IT ANYWAY!   EVERY. SINGLE. TIME.  It seems small but I come here often and it happens every time.   Second, the Grey haired older lady always has a shit attitude. Not once has she been pleasant to anyone. I don't know what her deal is but she makes the place look bad. As harsh as it sounds.   Besides that, like I said earlier, the food is amazing. The waiters are awesome. The ladies who refill chips and drinks are always on it! If the kitchen could get their shit together a little and if the lady could pull the stick out, this place would be perfect.  UPDATE! La Pinata is still my favorite Mexican restaurant of all time. I've upgraded my review to 4 stars. They've gotten a lot better about not giving me garnish. They recognize me because I've complained about it so much . The white haired lady is still grumpy and unapproachable. I feel like the bun on her head is going to unravel and turn into an evil serpent and kill us all!! Besides that, LOVE THE FOOD! Oh, and the bearded bartender... Damn! Sexy!

TGfH96rQ2OYu_wuTubeUfg.text: Drove by this place a few times and finally decided to stop in.  The marg's were great.  I ordered the chicken enchiladas suizas and, wow, I was impressed.  Usually, this dish is very neat, tiny rolled enchiladas with a dollop of sour cream on top.  Not this one.  The enchiladas were huge, smothered in delicious verde sauce and covered with sour cream ... literally, couldn't even see the enchiladas underneath.  So awesome.  Chicken was tender (though I don't think all white meat but it worked).  Arroz was moist and flavorful. The black beans were plentiful.  This place is the bomb.  Plus, I decided to take home an order of their Albondigas soup, something I love but have difficulty finding a good source for it.  This place is it.  The broth was delicious, just enough cilantro and heat to satisfy and the albondigas themselves were ping pong ball-sized meatballs filled with flavor.  Service and prices were great.  My go-to Mexican restaurant in Phoenix.

BxalFcOcyCsZXH2sSSlN_A.text: A hidden gem. Small, modern spanish designed restaurant with a great atmosphere, service and food. We passd this place all the time. This time we stopped in for a drink. Ended up eating shrimp fajita. Cheaper and better than our go to place for shrimp fajita.
