jElrdBNvFK3Qv9BPHcav4A.text: From the outside you would never know what an amazing place this is! The moment you walk inside it's like a hidden oasis! The decor and vibe is wonderful! And not to mention that the food is large portions and extremely tasty! Our waitress Jessie was so sweet and & helpful, as well as the lady who sat us! We are from California, although if we are ever out this way again we will make sure to come back!

vd3IFfro1giA9Jtiy0NK5w.text: One of my go to restaurants when I am in the area.  Anything I have ordered is great, but my favorite so far is the carnitas.  Flavorful, plentiful and downright delicious.

nt9yvZiw-198vGnuuXFTOg.text: If you've been or have lived in Phoenix for a while, you know that we have a lot of authentic Mexican restaurants. La Pinata, hands down, has one of the best Mexican dishes I've had in the valley! We ordered the chicken burrito with rice and beans on the side, and a bowl of chicken tortilla soup. Everything came out sizzling hot, fresh, and absolutely delicious. The service, although it was a busy Sunday night, was also on point.  The free chips and salsa were great. Since it was busy, we waited for about 10-15 mins for a party of two. However, once we were seated, our server was very attentive & took our orders right away. There is a small parking surrounding the restaurant. I haven't tried the drinks yet since there is a bar, but I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Part of the bar area.
Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken burrito! YUUUM.

UvUrbLq29entYXCbPbzxhA.text: It is hit or miss... all depends on who is working. The host that was working, he was very friendly. The waitress was in a hurry, and had to be reminded to bring stuff, but it was busy. I think it just a good casual Mexican restaurant. The drinks will not wow you.. I suggest the ordering 2 items and doing a half and half.. Parking Sucks!! So if you cannot find a spot.. just leave and come back another day.. I have eaten here many times.. so you be the judge!

jIxkI3guf60SGqT5264KxA.text: Food is ok, service is terrible.   Gave this new location another chance becuase a friend wanted to go there,  it was subpar at best.  They hire people who don't care, walk around clueless and laxadasical.   I used to love the old location, I won't go back to the new unless someone insists on going.  When there is a problem, it is always becuase of poor management.  Location is great,  service rates a zero and the food is ok. Taco kissi is way better.

RnUj8d_LpOUcNHwkJYMJNw.text: Chicken Tortilla Soup, to die for! Also best Chicken enchilada! Has a neighborhood feel with very excellent food.

wcQ-_UmTUk7QraKxb_HHHA.text: This is one of most favorite places to eat in Phoenix.  Highly recommend going here. The staff is always friendly, food always taste great, atmosphere is wonderful.

Muy41nIOJf1tGM5eFVvCrw.text: Saw this place on Check Please AZ, noticed that they have moved to a new location so we gave it a try. OMG!! The service was excellent, and the food even better. Everything was fresh and hot. The tacos were amazing and the Yucatan chimichanga was crisp with the cheese sauce smothering it.

rs_G2Wzd5xW8AiUxMBHipQ.text: Great service. Delicious Black Bean Tostada. They put the cheese on top of the beans so it melts then it has a full salad on top with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, carrots, red and green peppers. With a vinaigrette dressing to give it a great flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States

l15ccStuy1hiXUGDVlw9bA.text: Outstanding place!  Wife had the spinach enchiladas I had the carnitas dish and they were both excellent!  Great atmosphere and we loved it.  We will be back.

IJaJd43eVvjSn9zU-2cJUw.text: We love their food. Was SO bummed to learn the new location no longer does take out, which is what we usually get. The girl on the phone was short and just said "we are dine-in only" as if they'd never done take out and basically hung up on me. This has always been standard phone etiquette at La Pinata but without chicken tortilla soup take out as a result, I was not happy. Nice new digs but no take out, same poor service keeps me at 3 stars.

UKsLtQybAQ53tDfoau_8Rg.text: Literally everything on the menu is delicious. Great lunch specials during the week and the drinks are strong and refreshing, and pair perfectly with their food. Their patio is dog friendly as long as your furry friend is on a leash and knows how to behave. They are busy every night during the standard dinner rush but it's definitely worth the wait. If you don't want to wait to be sat, go in a bit later and you're guaranteed an amazing experience.

IWRN4OCsRzwHUcfTvgOoXw.text: Mexican cleansing, forget about fiber this place will clean your insides real good.  I didn't mind the over priced drinks or the low quality food but once I got the runs I knew I will never set foot on this place again.

H53uZOyjK_IBJFhLjrLx_A.text: Good food! Great atmosphere! Great patio. Staff was super friendly and accommodating! We will definately return!

HCIhnMiyh2BwTeVYxfHDQw.text: Absolutely delicious! Great decor, awesome staff. Tamales are the bomb! Yummy margaritas. New favorite Mexican restaurant.

eo2hgIKk9t7JXZk_0c28mQ.text: My family has been eating here for 30 years however since they moved to their new smaller location the service has been terrible. Their attitude seems like they don't need your business and they sincerely act like it. I thought their move would hurt Sylvia's Mexican food which is directly across the street however with there don't care attitude Sylvia's is busier than ever. Sorry to lose one of my favorite eating places but I won't spend my hard earned money for owners that take it for granted

HNrE1xB4oap1JzhKaFqkFg.text: The staff is very friendly and the food was fantastic.  The shredded beef tacos, rice and beans were really good. I'll be back with the family for sure.

wU-62PkXpig782H1pz0ZkQ.text: Been twice since they've opened and both times have liked the food. The staff has been great and attentive. No issues with owners/mgrs as stated in other reviews. Was disappointed when I read that take-out was not an option, so that' something to keep in mind. The food was very good and the prices are reasonable. Will return when looking to dine-in.

FzpSGyuYW0SwBefG2Yvs0Q.text: Love the new location.  Has a modern hip vibe, but yet still retained their authentic Mexican food.  Great combination!

P_NJXYjj66-frUYM75zFLg.text: I never went to the old location but I am a fan of the new place!  I have been to dinner there twice now and have had good meals and service both times.  The blood orange margarita is delish!  Service is pretty quick and efficient and the wait time both times I went wasn't that long.

aKLIFgUkHkJv9VyGdl-dqg.text: What a great experience.  A friend and I went in for dinner on 4/12. We ordered drinks, they came with no delay. Chips, food, water refills, "do you need anything?" We are good.  The service was outstanding. It seemed that all the people their cared about us having a good meal with no issues.   The food was good, drinks good... I'll be back.

ixvn-_couJTEbF6O2qylRA.text: How can a place that's been around Phoenix for over 40 years be anything but Great!!  La Pinata's new location serves the best Mexican food anywhere in the valley.  Chips and salsa are made fresh daily, sometime more often.  The place is spotlessly clean, the service is top notch and the food is the best!  The chef, Peter, is usually wandering around kibitzing with the new patrons as well as his regulars.  He's a hoot!  Eat on the patio if the weather permits.  It's beautiful with a large fireplace and flickering lights all over.  The food portions are more than generous and you can tell the ingredients are top quality.  If you have room, try the "baked ice cream" or the sopapias with honey or chocolate.  Go to this place once and you can be sure it will become one of your regulars.

5R_hjIiTECZDWv1MFsrLFg.text: This update is to drop La Pinata from 2 stars to one. I had been eating there from the 1970s when I worked nearby. I was sickened to think of all the dollars my family & friends and co-workers spent there over all those many decades when I read a comment on my review by the manager, "Peter B." I clicked his other reviews and found that he'd stooped to putting bad reviews on his competitors. I informed each one of them and one was upset, as he said, "I know the family." I reported this infraction of Yelp's standards to Yelp and they removed his negative comments from the reviews of Peter B.'s competitors. That is sad.

lH_SmevN6-6HiKU6BkGNCQ.text: Just left this place and we are sold!!! We ordered the nachos supreme appetizer which is a meal in of itself. My daughter ordered the mahi mahi fajitas which were to die for. The fish was spiced and grilled to perfection. My husband ordered the chicken chimichangas and it was so stuffed that he (who's got a huge appetite) wasn't able to finish. The food was plentiful and absolutely delicious!!  Now, our waiter... on point! Before we reached the bottom of our drinks, our glasses were filled. Before we finished our salsa, our bowls were filled. We never had to ask for anything- he was very attentive to our needs and very pleasant.   We HIGHLY recommend this place... five stars all the way!

-8mLccjfX5wouguPHzTTPw.text: I've been going to La Pinata for many, many years now, and I've never had a bad meal, or bad service of any kind. La Pinata, having opened in 1970, is a Phoenix landmark in the field of restaurants. It offers traditional Sonoran-style Mexican cuisine, and staple of any Phoenician's diet. The food is always excellent, and always has very nice presentation.  Their new location, Missouri and 7th, the old site of Mary Coyle's is smaller than the original location, but has a similar feel and atmosphere. I've had the pleasure of knowing a couple of the owners for many years, and was very sad to see Leonard go a little while ago, as he made my experience even better, but I still enjoy visiting whenever I can immensely.    I will never stop coming to La Pinata, as I have been coming here since I was very young, so it will continue to be apart of my life.

9XE6b4q_pxmVPcweUZVuFw.text: We went to lunch with Mom "82" at La Pinata a couple of days ago. It was really, really Awesome!!  We are native Phoenician's and we had never been but Wow great Food, Great service and Great atmosphere.  Mom had the lunch special 2 tacos, rice and beans and it was huge and homemade and fabulous!! She was impressed and she knows Great Mexican food.  We had chili relleno and a cheese crisp and it was all wonderful.  Definitely will be back and having the green corn tamales!!

FjLZwgHaD_ShhCA3DWdRqA.text: Tasty fresh food and friendly service. We order take home from here almost every week. Recently had a problem with our order - mistakes happen  - and they took care of it promptly

47V2JqOLhqfTjLrFuBNZ_g.text: You know I love steak. Found this awesome place after a fun trip downtown.   We got there five minutes before they opened on a Sunday. People were already waiting at the door to go in. The entrance is in the back and has a very pretty Spanish style garden theme.   We had great seats inside. The space is just the right size but they also have outdoor seating. Loved the decor, the atmosphere and the food, of course!  The server was so nice and helpful. Asked a few questions and I was sold on the steak fajitas. They are covered in a super yummy sauce. Not dry at all. The veggies underneath were perfectly cooked. Large portions. I had to take some home.   Everything tasted amazing. By the time we finished our meal, the place was packed and more customers were waiting for tables.   We will definitely make the drive out here for those fajitas!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WhC7vUzKT1kBg1a8jOgSTQ.text: One of my favorites in the Valley, They are known for the chimichangas, however I think their tamales are the best. We always try something different every time we come here. Really haven't found anything bad. Portions are huge, so if you are thinking about sharing, this is the place to do it. Rice and beans are very good. They do offer black beans also. Plates come to your table piping hot, so be aware. The salsa with your chips is a little in the hot side, this is the way I like it.  Service is good, can get busy there so sometimes you might need a little patients.

5FTJLAqyWOP920-605eZVQ.text: We have always loved La Pinata! My husband's family has been coming here for many years and we even had La Pinata cater our wedding. (Thank you!) We love their chips and salsa, as well as everything we've ordered, ha. We enjoy bringing groups of friends and family here to try one of our favorite restaurants in the Valley.

photos.caption: Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mixed fajita

gJJhEhyag8kFrTO4F3JKNA.text: As a native Texan, I must say I haven't been able to find a Mexican restaurant in Phoenix that comes close to the "Tex Mex" style of back home, until now! This place is absolutely delicious and has the quality, portion size, and flavor I've grown to love back home.  One of the best things about this place, in my opinion,  is there is generally never more than a 15 minute wait given the ample space and seating of the restaurant. The staff is also highly attentive and very friendly. Once you are seated, prepare to devour some seriously delicious salsa. Pro tip: don't eat too much of the salsa as the portions here are very generous.  As far as the food goes, I always end up getting the fajitas as they are crazy delicious. They also seem to always be perfectly cooked. Never over done! I highly recommend them. Drink selection is pretty standard for a Mexican restaurant. I've had several of their margaritas and they are generally quite tasty without being ruined with too much sugar.  All in all, if you want some delicious and hearty Mexican food at an affordable price, this is pretty much my go to in the area. Definitely try it out! Your tummy will thank you :).

3qcQZ8d-25u8QN7_Azht7Q.text: Amazing food. The chicken and steak was very juicy and well flavored. No need for extra sauces due to this. Rice and beans very tasty...not very cheesy on the beans (my preference) Service was nice and quick ; ambience of restaurant very good. Overall 9/10...only cause of the salsa chips, they were meh..will come back again!!

AVTtEzIyuV6HHb99Q2fcMw.text: Very flavorful food.  The rice and beans were nice and hot.  Chips and salsa were not anything to brag about. Taco meat is delicious and cooked perfectly.  No lumps of fat just nice juicy meat and a perfectly fried shell. The room is small and loud and filled up quickly on a Friday morning right at the opening.

O3QgSYMPmXhYCplMuD3X7g.text: My favorite Mexican place in the valley. I dream about their chimis and love the vibe. Part of me wants to keep this place a secret, but the secret is out.

UgX85qifmPWdZh5GnFGHDA.text: This pace has some of the best red chili beef I've ever had. I love the Mary Lou and the burritos. The salsa is very good too.   I have to mention that their Paloma's and margaritas are fantastic.   This little place has been around for quite awhile and had driven by many times without stopping in. Wow what a mistake. Once I stopped I won't be passing by so often now.

bZ0t73xH8h9vrdmmVjY2cQ.text: Good Mexican place! Lots of room, quick seating, and good food! I especially like the house margarita and cheese enchiladas. Our waitress was quick and brought the meal quickly. I would recommend this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of La Piñata - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fiesta Hour

_VuKxVgiL3DXDshkc5hk8A.text: This place is great! Small and always busy! Shaded patio with employees who are always smiling and helpful! THE BEST CHEESE CRISPS!!! Awesome neighborhood spot!

sgokwf35rwKcvO7hatLp_g.text: Came with a group of friends. Ate the cheese crisp with diced green chiles. No pic cuz we were hungry. Good crunch and not too greasy. Then we ordered our entrees. This place has generous portions! I got the number 5, which had a chicken taco and chicken enchilada. I added a fried egg. Sooo good. Good sauce, easy to cut with a fork and the Spanish rice is so good. I posted pics of what my friends got: number 1, 2 and a la carte. We ordered dessert of fried ice cream. The cornflakes were uniformly encrusted around the ice cream. The shell was a pretty touch. It's a good place to eat. Service was good if not a little slow.

k0FHHeZEZ4ngP_OdlbYEgQ.text: First time visiting new location. Went in for the pinata app. Didn't disappoint.  Same great taste. I'm  in love with their jalapeno cream cheese. You can buy a half or pint to go. I did for my bagels

mK7LnWN5C3gmAVv8BbhZIQ.text: Their food and margaritas are delicious. Tio poncho con queso is my favorite thing to get here. Service could be better. Don't recommend going here if you're in a rush.

hfkdNC4WP_DvxVHDTTdMoA.text: I wish yelp offered 3.5 stars because that would be my True rating but since they don't I'm gonna give this place a 4 simply because of the great service. Let's start with the food...it's good, it's authentic and it's always fresh. I've had several combos, I have come mostly for lunch. My fav is the ground beef taco (and I don't even eat ground beef) and the cheese enchilada. The portions are huge so you can always share a combo. The chips and salsa are a meal all by themselves so make sure you save room.   Now for my no go's at here. The margaritas. Not my fav. For many reasons all the way from mix, to flavor to price. Stick to a beer or wine if you want a cocktail. The guacamole is also not my fav. It's fresh but bland so I don't think it's worth the price of a side of guacamole.   Otherwise come eat here the food is good you will be satisfied and you will have leftovers!

yZbv7yLRf2JCLB34RGAwcg.text: There is good and there is bad. The good - taco Tuesday, with the selection of happy hour tacos, are some of the best tacos I've ever had. The bad: the menu says the taco specials run from 3 PM until close. Unfortunately, both nights the waiters have said that the taco specials ended before we were gone, which was a lot before close. False advertising!   If we can still order before close, the specials should be honored. The waiter had to adjust the ordering, to honor what the menu says. The owners or management need to straighten this out.    And ECfive stars except for the deceptive practice  ******  Here again on taco Tuesday.   3 Mexican beers on special all night.   Nice.   Inexpensive tacos.  The shredded beef was a bit salty, but with cold beer, plenty of lettuce, tomato and cheese it was just fine.  Friendly waiter and Stanley Cup playoffs on the bar TV---all good

ZTxw2JUO4Frdlt23WiXHzw.text: One of the featured restaurants in the July 2019 issue of Phoenix mag so we had to try it and really enjoyed it. This is classic Mexican in our book from the beans and rice to the carnitas and chimichangas burros. Great margaritas and guacamole too. Will make this a regular stop!

UaNAUzu6gGmhTo1tbgGmiQ.text: I've been to this place a number of times for lunch.  Quickly becoming one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the Phoenix area.  Ordered multiple items, everything is excellent!  Recommendations include the Chorizo and eggs platter, carne asada burrito, and machacca burrito.   We've had Maggie be our sever a few occasions and she is tremendous.  Always offering recommendations, very personable and conversational.  The host (who I assume is one of the owners as well) is also wonderful to talk with.  One tip - be sure to ask for their hot salsa with your chips if you are a fan of spicy foods!

TZCMx_U1xQmCqq-8sOT6DA.text: Great neighborhood restaurant.  Casual dining with a comfortable dining area.  Staff was extremely friendly and attentive.  Ordered the combo beef and chicken fajitas with corn tortillas.  Food was excellent, chicken and beef cooked perfectly, grilled vegetables, guacamole, and rancho beans were great.  Crowded for a Thursday night but order was taken promptly and food was delivered quickly. Prices are reasonable.

vOhsZ6knmCt-eDb1Mu9Lgw.text: Okay, so this location is new but the food is AMAZING. Being Mexican I know good Mexican food and this is what I compare all Mexican food against now. I've been going to La Pinata since I was a kid, and my parents used to go since they were in high school. The owner uses his mothers recipes and they are to die for. You will not be disappointed with the food or service here, guaranteed.

tqLD3UaPkpXQPJE4QZMaOQ.text: I love this place! It is easily one of my favorite spots whether it's for happy hour, lunch, or dinner! The service is friendly and attentive, the food is fantastic, and the atmosphere is pretty cool too! I even had my last birthday dinner here and they did a wonderful job. Their patio is dog friendly and shaded which is a nice draw as well. I highly suggest the green corn tamales and the green chili but, honestly, I haven't had anything I didn't like. They have a great cocktail menu too!

Z4_RilqhstyiOcHx9fRiLg.text: Jeez- why did this place have to move from the older location?  The quality of the food has gone south big time! The tortilla chips with the chips and salsa were all broken into small pieces. The margarita on the rocks was ALL sweet mixer and very little tequila. The red chili beef is now very greasy- total let down. My wife had the pork carnitas burro- the pork was SO dry and bland. What happened??? Seems like they became too popular too quickly at the new location and the quality control is gone. Extremely disappointed and sad. Doubt we will return.

YDk_x8_sHr0a-5N2J-mV6A.text: Yum. Every time so good. I've been going here for 15 years, since they were at the 19th ave location, and plan to go for the next 15+ years. Best hot sauce and chicken tacos (among other things) in town.

r9inogGVbHzGhG1ZTNfGvQ.text: The biggest problem I had with this place is we asked the waitress to split the bill in half.... It was about fifty bucks and an even number. And she ran my card at $30 and my friends card at $15 and said she "didn't know how" to split it. She could have asked before running our cards. Or taken a calculated and divided by 2? Idk. Pretty annoying. Other than that they do have big portions of food and some stuff is good some stuff is okay. I wouldn't recommend the steak taquitos as they are very bland and over cooked. The tio fundido chimichanga is really good though. This place is okay...

ZvZbrweQ5QAywlfHx2NAzg.text: Pros:Food is good, locations is pretty. Cons: not home made beans, bad service, very pricey.

mzoFWl0IJGbo72o_1TNdGw.text: you know what they say  if the Chili Reno is good the rest of the food is awesome    and the Chili Reno was awesome    first time at this place and it has just become my new favorite place... Mexican food is my Favorite   cant wait to bring my family and friennds here     I want to try so many different things    I so cant wait  Ill be back  ASAP  Thank you Owners of this restruant  you are doing amazing    :)

KKNSVC1N0-AvVQI8qmokUw.text: LP's new location is IMO central Phoenix's best mexican restaurant. It is what Tee Pee used to be. Just solid, somewhat pricey but solid sloppy mexican food at its finest. Everything is great, simple, basic, by the book, mexican food. I did not like how they would not allow me to take home a meal off the children's menu for my daughter, even though the rest of our order was well above $60 but I guess that is their policy. Other than that, and the lack of attractive female bartenders, is the only qualm I have with this place.

ixVD3uQiH70AyX4gt2l0fA.text: We loved (and had reviewed) the old location.  The place was a Phoenix tradition.  We were totally bummed to hear they were closing but then excited to hear they would take over the Mary Coyle/Appettitos building.  I was glad to have some competition for Sylvia's.  It us nice they got a regulation replica sign for the place because that is vintage stuff.  They did a really nice job of making use of the space there and I think they might have added some dining space.  I was disappointed that the agave margaritas are gone as are some of the other menu favorites.   Thank goodness they still have the machaca chimichangas because they are AWESOME and always have been.   I miss the kitsch of the old place in its 70's vibe but this is nice.  However, the prices are a little higher.

KPXsG219waDQaMFD-v1JAQ.text: What a wonderful time we had! My sisters and cousins and myself went to celebrate a couple of birthdays! everybody loved  there food, the wait staff was excellent! The place was decorated so beautifully! The patio looked gorgeous, they had a fire going! We'll definitely be back!

5HBvHNJVAP3kkGuHNrtkTw.text: Very welcoming atmosphere got stuck sitting in the bar stools but not bad! Good food and service

jcVrri9E2G6vxOEwsSnNsw.text: Food is good, drinks are good, chips are great, salsa is great. The service however is not all that good, seems like every time I go back service is more neglectful...

tTmlE98pFXpPPDhf9YY6sw.text: Excellent authentic Mexican cuisine.  Loved the chicken tacos and tamales the most.  Very comfortable dining room.  Our waiter (Jose N.) was attentive, friendly and terrific.  Give this place a try - you will enjoy the food and drinks.

ozicp_4ZVHF-VqLv06iRFQ.text: Awsome Mexican food!! Especially if you're new around here and coming from California!! The owner and staff are great and perfect on their customer service. Came in for a to go and the owner was so nice and sweet she convinced us to stay and eat. Beautiful on the inside as well!! Well satisfied

5SrkY4lDcMNmrAh4n1Tu4w.text: Great atmosphere, upscale feel with reasonable prices and excellent service.   Our server, Anthony was outstanding, he made the experience a home run.  The food was good, we had tacos (don't get ground beef, try the chicken or shredded beef).  My wife had a nice chicken breast meal and my daughter enjoyed the tamales, everything we had was good.  The patio was warm despite cold outdoor Temps with a fireplace and great ambiance.   We highly recommend and will be back for sure.

Uef_YNg1pwoZV7D3frRYpg.text: Always enjoy my experience at La Pinata, the service has been outstanding the food always consistent, I started going to the original location over 20 years ago and it just doesn't get any better than this.

Y7UjxT0UcnEfw7zoGtkHbg.text: Excellent food! Stopped here in a whim. Best Mexican food I've had in a long time. I had the Chimichanga with shredded beef. Excellent flavor. Great salsa, guacamole. Ilene was an awesome server, every time I thought to even ask for something it appeared on my table before I asked. Truly great lunch.

F8NTdhEXNnw25-8IlUHSYA.text: Still good as they always been, new location is cool. Wish they'd bring back carne asada torta.

iGIXN1VUotLEllE3HJbssA.text: I must say that Rose Ann and her Staff at la pinata out did themselves! We went back and could not be happier with the service and food!   Thank you Rose Ann and Pete for taking care of us and showing that your customers matter!! We love it and will be back!!

EGNWl0R6Y2pNCjZRSHUngA.text: Food was excellent! I ordered the steak fajitas which were delicious.  Salsa was great, not too spicy.  Beans and rice were tasty. Service was great. Check this place out!

5Q3PtT6H0jKPvTLGq3OSdg.text: By far the BEST Mexican food I have had here in the valley! Always a wait but always worth it! The staff is amazing! Starting from the little cute host that greats you at the door to the amazing food they place on your table! I live this place! Everyone needs to give it a taste! The red enchiladas are the BOMB! I kinda wish the queso was hot (spicy)

xj6KIt8FVHSrki6yigE2zQ.text: ok.  parking here is a joke.  you can come 10 minutes after they open and can't find a spot.  i get takeout because am alone and don't want eat there alone.  anyway, takeout food is generous and good but always cold.  Always.

MFOBjwvGVj4wjBnuvnfcLA.text: Staff is out of this world. Very sweet and very considerate. They definitely make the experience. True Mexican food that is ALWAYS good. If you don't like what you get, they find something you do. Seriously so awesome. And great chips and salsa!

wbQdib-E0rmGTJj-eQIDww.text: I came here on an early Friday night and there wasn't a wait, so that was nice. The parking lot is a little tight and we did notice a wait/packed lot when we left close to 7 pm. The atmosphere was rather dull and I honestly was underwhelmed from the reviews I read and the 4 star rating. The service was decent and happy hour menu had some good items available. I loved the reg. queso and the fried flour tortilla chips served  with it! Made me think I was back home in Texas! The salsa is a typical traditional red salsa that was good, but nothing to rave about. I had the la pina cocktail that was surprisingly not too sweet, but not sure if it's worth $9. I shared beef fajitas with the hubby and we were surprised with the restaurants' version of fajitas. It was literally slow cooked brisket style fajitas with a brown gravy on top? But it did come with a generous amount of refried beans and rice. Our meal came with 3 tortillas and we asked for more to take home with our leftovers. We were charged for $1.50 for 2 tortillas... I've NEVER had to pay extra for tortillas lol. I wasn't even informed it would cost extra especially since they weren't anything special . I think it's kind of silly that a restaurant at this price point feels the need to charge their customers who probably spends a good amount of money to dine at their establishment. As a couple we spent $50 with a tip and have gotten more value and satisfaction at other Mexican restaurants. Was this place terrible? No. was it worth the money? No. Was it a fun and cool atmosphere? No. 2 months ago I ordered Uber eats from a Mexican restaurant at the same price point and similar style and got waaaay more of a value and was super pleased with just a to- go order! I think that says a lot.

F8FlEMz_Nf3kRctg1gn0bw.text: We loved this place at their old location on 19 Ave., and, we love this location, too. The new location is beautiful without the tradition kitschy decor, but, a tasteful modern feel. The food is almost the same as before, with some of the best Carne Macache in town. The chip and salsa are very good, along with the offerings of the full bar. They offer both indoor and patio seating. The service is still very good. It can get very busy, especially on weekends, but, well worth the wait.

MyRk6xMKzQXNi2iGj6rXLQ.text: Deliciousness - 3/5  Happiness - 3/5  The inside definitely doesn't match the outside. It is very swanky and cool, with an impressive-looking bar in the middle.  We went with a big group. Thus, we got a wide range of food - none of it bad, but plenty of it was mediocre. The chimichangas are darn-near-perfect. Too many places lack the crunch a chimi should have. They have managed to maintain the crunchy taste while still loading it with cheese and sauce. The machaca meat was also pretty good, as were the tacos. We ordered guacamole as and appetizer and a few different types of margaritas, none of which were particularly memorable. The waiter was attentive, but over-sold the spice level of the food (I found very few things to be spicy. In fact, I was piling on the pre-meal salsa to my burrito to get the needed kick!). A lot of the dinner entrees also require extra for rice and beans. That said, the entrees are so big and hearty, virtually none of us finished our complete meals (including the heavy eaters in our group!).   Also, I love tamales, but don't eat pork. Sadly, this disqualifies many a tamale place and La Pinata joins the group (they do have a green corn tamale too, but I simply don't like green corn ones).   The kids meal is too expensive at six dollars, and also overloaded with beans and rice.   The bottom line is it's nice food with big portions. The price is also very reasonable (other than the kids meals). It's definitely not the best Mexican I have had in Phoenix, but it has more than enough unique menu items to make it good to go into any good Mexican rotation.

7V09tQVpIklC4rG0vdqLmw.text: As a family who has visited this establishment more than once, I am very disappointed in the service I received recently and I will likely not be back. I was excited when this restaurant opened in my neighborhood ~ they took quite some time to offer "to go" food. I can appreciate  getting your bearings, but as a pregnant woman on strict bed rest who was craving Mexican food, it was disappointing that they were not able to serve us.  Their food is decent ~ tex~ mex only, if that's what you're in to. We don't go often but tonight after screwing up an at home dinner we thought we'd go. Now at home with twins, we also don't go out often but order to go food frequently.  When we ordered two meals and a kids quesadilla, we were told that they do not offer kids's meals to go.....because they do not have containers for kid's size meals. WHAT??? You can't offer me a kids quesadilla to go because the container is not the right size?  When pushed they said "no" because they just don't offer kids meals to go. So regular meals to go are finally ok, but no kids. If you offer it on your website, why don't you offer it to go? The manager, Terri, said that when the owner tells her something, she just does it, no questions asked.  So she couldn't even give me a a logical reason for not making me this kids meal.  With only decent food and ridiculous "rules" of business that you can't justify or explain, I will happily take my family's business, kids included, elsewhere.

1CE1Kdu03-zMfXO9iJlt5w.text: Best Mexican food that I've ever had- hands down! My fiance and I eat here almost every week. Everything on the menu is amazing! Be sure to go for Taco Tuesday. We always ask for Reese as our server. He is so kind and enthusiastic- clearly loves his job.

0DF3DcX0qQakqPlJjslpMw.text: I love the new location!  They made the move from their old location on 19th Avenue and Osborn to the old Mary Coyle building on 7th Avenue and Missouri recently. Glad they moved, the old one had great food but the location was getting a little sketchy. They did a complete renovation of the inside. Nice modern Mexican theme.   Same great food here at the new one. Excellent service. It was packed when I was here.   Great chips and salsa to start out.   I had the green chili quesadilla and albondigas soup for my entree. Both really good. The green chili was hot! My friends had beef chimichangas and said they were excellent.    I am looking forward to going back here.   Check out the new location!   Enjoy!

oePeJbdkTRsg6GVhvHqTig.text: I had moved out of state and had not been to La Pinata for over 30 years.  I now know why I remembered this Restaurant after all these years. The shredded beef in the taco also was deliciously seasoned.  This is the type of Mexican food that I loved when growing up in Arizona!  I can't wait to go back again.
